Summary: Bright orange-red ball traveling south to northeast, bigger and faster than ISS.
trends: There have been 39 other sightings in Erie
There were no other sightings in Erie on or around July 4th 2010
divs: Sighting DetailsMy wife and i are avid star watchers, every clear night we spend 3 to 4 hours with telescope and binoclers spotting satelights and other terestrial objects. Last night at 10:55 a bright orangish red ball that was bigger and faster than the ISS has ever been traveled from the southern sky northeasterly until it was below our line of sight. The ISS was traveling last night at the same time but traveling NNW to ENE so it wasn't the ISS. It seemed to curve from the south to east to northeast on a desending pattern, seemed bigger, brighter and faster than the ISS.
